pullrequest.title: Topological map from tsv to dot

content.raw:
Fixed a bug related to python2/3. Python3 sorts dictionary keys automatically, Python2 doesn't, so vertex numbers needed 1.`abs()`, and 2. sorting, to make edge outputs and PDF pretty.

`test_topo_tsv.dot` committed. For easier diffing, since the vertex numbers are all different, highlighting `tile_5:` in search results helps.

Changed base station tile label to `BaseStation`. The next one still starts at 1, since tile 0 is base. The original `.dot`file had base as tile 4, so the next one started as tile 0.

In the original `tunnel_qual.dot`, vertex 7 does not exist. hence the off-by-one.

The total number of vertices is the same, even though `tunnel_qual.dot` ends at 119 and the new `.dot` ends at 109. This is because the original `.dot` did not have vertices 7, 26, 28, 29, 31, 32, 70, 71, 79, and 103, total of 10 vertices, which accounts for the difference in count. For a rigorous diff, one could do a thorough string replacement of these offsets.
content.html:
Fixed a bug related to python2/3. Python3 sorts dictionary keys automatically, Python2 doesn't, so vertex numbers needed 1.abs(), and 2. sorting, to make edge outputs and PDF pretty.

test_topo_tsv.dot committed. For easier diffing, since the vertex numbers are all different, highlighting tile_5: in search results helps.

Changed base station tile label to BaseStation. The next one still starts at 1, since tile 0 is base. The original .dotfile had base as tile 4, so the next one started as tile 0.

In the original tunnel_qual.dot, vertex 7 does not exist. hence the off-by-one.

The total number of vertices is the same, even though tunnel_qual.dot ends at 119 and the new .dot ends at 109. This is because the original .dot did not have vertices 7, 26, 28, 29, 31, 32, 70, 71, 79, and 103, total of 10 vertices, which accounts for the difference in count. For a rigorous diff, one could do a thorough string replacement of these offsets.
